verses.roman:
sevato varṣa-pūgān me
urvaśyā adharāsavam
na tṛpyaty ātma-bhūḥ kāmo
vahnir āhutibhir yathā

synonyms: sevataḥ—who was serving; varṣa-pūgān—for many years; me—my; urvaśyāḥ—of Urvaśī; adhara—of the lips; āsavam—the nectar; na tṛpyati—never became satisfied; ātma-bhūḥ—born from the mind; kāmaḥ—the lust; vahniḥ—fire; āhutibhiḥ—by oblations; yathā—just as.
translation: Even after I had served the so-called nectar of the lips of Urvaśī for many years, my lusty desires kept rising again and again within my heart and were never satisfied, just like a fire that can never be extinguished by the oblations of ghee poured into its flames.
